com.rental.web.controller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rental.web.controller.UserController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/v1/user")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object

    Controller class for handling user requests for creating a new user and retrieving existing user information.

    • Method Detail

      • createUser

        @RequestMapping(method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserResource> createUser(@RequestBody @Validated
                                                                                                      UserResource sentUser)

        POST method to create a new user.

        Parameters:
        sentUser - that need to be persisted in database.
        Returns:
        UserResource with all the information of the newly created user and the appropriate HTTP status code.
        Throws:
        UserExistsException - is the user has already been created.

      • getUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/{name}",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserResource> getUser(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String name)

        GET method to retrieve a specific user user the Username created originally.

        Parameters:
        name - representing the user name that was created originally with the user.
        Returns:
        UserResource wrapped in the response entity with the appropriate HTTP status code.
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the request user was not found.

      • createRental

        @RequestMapping(value="{userId}/rental",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<RentalResource> createRental(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                                                                                                    @RequestBody @Validated
                                                                                                                                                    RentalResource rentalResource)

        POST method to create a new rental request for a user.

        Parameters:
        userId - representing the user id of the user requesting to rent the bicycles.
        rentalResource - representing the newly rented bike information the customer wants.
        Returns:
        RentalResource with the complete information wrapped in response entity with the appropriate HTTP code.
        Throws:
        UserDoesNotExistsException - if the user has not been created
        InvalidDateException - if the date for the request if prior than today date.
